reviews.review_msg:
Saba is my personal GOAT of SFU. If you just ask questions and show up (and maybe carry your group project) it is SUUUUPER free. Midterms were graded pretty fairly, group project too.

Just be ready to do pop quizzes tbh.

Saba's lectures were kinda boring and sometimes difficult to follow. This class has a group project and that ofc depends massively on group RNG but is generally ok. There were also pop quizzes but if you showed up and just copied whatever she wrote during the discussion afterwards you got 100% on those. Overall ok-ish
Saba was great. She has pop quizzes based on lectures but you are pretty much guaranteed 100% on them if you just follow along in class.

Lectures were boring, I haven't learned a lot from the lectures. I only went in case there was a pop quiz. Aside from that, her course was structured well, although the grading scheme held a bit more emphasis on midterms and assignments rather than the group project that took up the majority of the time. Overall great prof and fun group project.

Saba's lectures felt dry and boring, I didn't learn much in this course. We had a group project, but it was mostly unrelated to the lecture material and we were forced to do everything on our own, including organizing in our groups. The midterms are just random questions from the slides, they are simple tests of memorization.
Come on you guys, you cant give Jane Mcdonald a 2 and give Saba anything less than a 5. She is chill, caring and she knows a lot. Shes great.
she has pop quiz, but they are just directly from the most recent lecture. Classes are engaging, fair exams. Can't complain.
10/10 would take classes with her again. Awesome human.
good prof. Caring, consider and knowledgeable. Fun lectures.

And also, be comfortable with Java. Why not? Java is heavily used for OOP in industry, and if you go to school just to be in your comfort zone, maybe dont do comp sci? If you have a good foundational knowledge of C++, you will understand that Java helps not reinvent the wheel, auto cleans garbage and focus on good coding practice, that's all..

I am a current 276 student w Saba F24, and she is knowledgeable, supportive, engaging, funny, accessible outside office, fantastic lectures, exams are highly correlated with what taught in class. The dude who said her lecture is dry PROBABLY NEVER SHOWED UP AT LECTURE AT ALL?. Anyways, I am grateful to have been her student. Learnt a lot so far!
Good prof

She makes us learn Java when she has very little Java knowledge. Unclear grading as TAs do not provide any feedback so they can arbitrarily deduct marks. Takes forever to release marks and also does not release midterms so will have no idea what went wrong.
Saba is a good instructor. She provides clear and constant instructions, and has good lectures.

She is the best prof I have ever had in my WHOLE life! Stronly recomand this prof. Saw some comments sayin shes bad, they are jokers. Super easy course and easy A+. Do not mind others comments just take this prof and you will get a exceptional good grade! What a gem!

She was very great! Everything was organized, and the lectures were not dry at all. There could be some pop quizzes so attendance is kind of mandatory. She was also helpful outside the class, and the grading was not tough at all. Overall, I enjoyed my semester with her. She definitely does not deserve 2.5. For me, she was 4.

She just added 2 assignments on the last 2 weeks of the semester, which is just ridiculous, when there are finals we need to study for. She did not release a grading scheme until halfway in the semester. The lectures, don't get me started, she does not add any useful information in class. Overall, this was poorly organized and I am dissatisfied.

Exams are marked very hard, the average for the second midterm was 50% before scale. Her lectures are terrible, very dry and you do not learn much but she has pop quizzes so you kinda need to to go. Overall, she is a horrible teacher and had a bad experience in this course.
disorganized and does pop quizzes but shes not the worst

Very solid prof. Background in Java or C/C++/C# will be an asset. Low work load and very open to extensions. Content is generally easy. Has consistently had group term projects, so group RNG will be a factor in experience. Even if she doesn't respond to your emails, she probably still read it so don't worry too much.

Saba is a young professor who has not mastered her craft yet, but she is very good at what she does, I recently took cmpt 276 with her and she was very good at explaining concepts. She was very easy to reach after lectures and was always willing to help with a positive attitude. 

I think saba is great, for 276 start your projects early though.

Saba is brilliant and amazing, although I wish she communicated with the class more ahead of time. She's understanding and the course material isn't that hard. This course's difficulty entirely depends on the group you are assigned, and unfortunately, if your group sucks then you'll have to deal with it. That's my only complaint.

I read the reviews before coming into this course and thought it would not be as bad, I was wrong. The course is in Java and she admitted that she has not used Java in several years. It feels she does not care about this course at all, do your money and time a favor by not taking this course with her.

Her notes are filled with fancy words and terrible examples that are unrelated to the assignments. Even she knows her lectures are terrible as she constantly asks the class for feedback with no response. On top of this she just tells you to make a game in Java, without any instruction on how to even code in Java, let alone how to make a game.

Saba unfortunately does not know how to teach. her slides are written with so much jargon they might as well be written in Spanish. She will ask the class questions about the slides she hasn't read yet and complain when they do not respond. Please take this course with another professor.

IF YOU WANT TO LEARN SOFTWARE ENGINEERING, do NOT take this class with Saba. Even if there is no other class. This class doesnt help for an actual job, nor do you learn anything besides history that makes you fall asleep. It is just a normal java class you can learn on your own in a few weeks. Also have fun trying to contact her, nearly impossible

What even was this class. Intro to software engineering was more of intro to disorganized java. I 100% recommend taking this class with ANY other prof. Bobby chan, Brian Fraser , > Saba. Saba is not meant to be a prof and that shows with based off other reviews. If you wanna be thrown tons of work at urself at random times, have fun. Else, drop it.

The most realistic review you will get is this one here: - She is very unorganized (doesnt decide the course grading until midway through the semester) - Nearly impossible to reach outside of office hours - Be aware of surprise assignments near final exam time, she threw 2 assignments at us after our final project - You dont learn much

Basically, what the others said, handed out 2 assignments that are due during the final exam period. no course grading scheme was available until halfway through the course. WILL NOT reply to your emails she is literally inaccessible outside of class. does not grade assignments on time. she is just very very disorganized. Avoid

(2.5/5) Disorganized class, grading scheme was given halfway through the semester, dropped 2 assignments 2 weeks before classes are done. Lectures are fine, not the worst. The project is a 2D maze game in Java, not a fan of the idea. Good luck with contacting her, won't respond to emails or canvas, go to her OH. Quizzes are memorization of slides

Boringgggggggg. 3 lectures in and I became snorlax. History of software > actual learning/doing of today software in this class. You want to code? Nope, not in this class you wont. You want an organized prof? Nope not in this class you wont. You want to become a software engineer? Nope not in this class you wont. Only good thing is the sleep.

If you do not know Java, then get ready to put extra work in learning it. The other section was taught by Brian and he goes over the basics for a few weeks while Saba jumps right into the materials of the project after week 1. There will be a massive group project. Many assignments. So if you arent good with Java; dont take this yet.

Great person, sometimes brings her cat to lecture too. However, the class was a complete mess, two assignments were never given out due to a lack of preparation. You must have Java experience! Quizzes were easy, the project was not very easy but it is hard to not get an A if you have something that works. No final, no midterm.

Professor Alimadadi is very nice and caring, she has good intentions but poor executions for many things in general. This class was quite a mess and I learned very little from her. The good thing is her quizzes are fair and easy. It is EXTREMELY difficult to reach her. If you email her, good luck, she probably won't reply to you.
She is a great professor.

She is a great and considerate person. But I'll say her teaching is mediocre at best. You basically have to self-learn Java if you have no experience in it as all assignments and the project are in Java but Java was not covered in class.

A promising new professor. She's a good lecturer with reasonable expectations and a fair course breakdown. Her 276 course did not have a final, which was nice for a content heavy course. There is a lot of material, so often she would race through lectures, speedily covering information rather than teaching it. Nonetheless, a solid choice for 276.

She is so hilarious. All her assignment documents are very ambiguous. She is not willing to help. In her class, she is speaking from the begin to the end but there is not a single useful sentence. SFU new instructors are worse for every year.

Literally every single CMPT class I attended at SFU so far uses C/C++ yet she assumed the students to understand Java already. Admittedly, there are a lot of similarities between Java and C/C++ but for the most of the assignments, Google was more useful than the teacher.

It was Prof Saba's first course teaching us, Since it was her first time, many things can be improved for sure. But there's one thing i can tell is that she is very caring for her students and we can really feel it. Decent amount of work and I learned a lot about coding my first game in java! Go to her office hour and she is extremely helpful!
